source_info.name: Les Marchands Restaurant & Wine Shop
source_info.categories: Nightlife, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Event Planning & Services, Bars, Food, Venues & Event Spaces, American (New), Wine Bars, Restaurants

review_info.review_text:
Had the chicken and waffles and it was surprisingly good! Waffles were perfectly prepped and the chicken was the nice mix of crispy yet moist. It did come with honey which was unexpected for me since I'm from the East Coast and would normally have some delish Canadian Maple syrup.

Service was quick and friendly. Very efficient. Loved having brunch on the outside patio. Cute little location with great ambiance.

The only thing I'd recommend is to work on the cold brew coffee I got. Not sure if it was how it was prepped but the coffee was off (tasted very light).

This was the best brunch experience we had in Santa Barbara during this weekend. Grace was fantastic and beautifully described all of the dishes we asked about. Service is on point and OMG get the smoked pork shoulder- to die for. Also, maybe the best Bloody Mary I've ever had. Reservations encouraged, definitely a must see.

It really is ABOUT THE WINE:  

In an area such as the Santa Barbara waterfront, where wine offerings are a plenty, make time to stop at Les Marchands.   This wine bar goes beyond a tasting room and is as good as it gets if you're looking for one stop offering of impeccable service, knowledgable staff, gracious hospitality, outdoor patio, and a wine list that represents the California footprint with expertise.  

Food pairings are a delight when reading up on their menu, you'll be excited to read the names of many hard to find, stunning wines from local family owned, small production vitners as a common offering at this wine bar, i.e. Bryan Babcock's "Ocean's Ghost" Pinot Noir (a 92 point effort on the 2016 bottling).  

The only crime is that I live so far away and can only enjoy when I return home to California!

response: Les Marchands Restaurant & Wine Shop is a versatile and upscale establishment located in Santa Barbara's heart, offering a blend of American cuisine, wine, and event services. The venue is known for its sophisticated ambiance, with both outdoor and intimate seating, and free WiFi, making it an ideal spot for groups and couples. With a 4.5-star rating, customers praise the restaurant's ability to provide impeccable service, especially during brunch, and highlight dishes like the chicken and waffles and smoked pork shoulder. The wine selection is particularly noteworthy, with a curated list that showcases California's finest offerings, including exclusive and high-rated wines. While some reviewers mention minor issues with the cold brew coffee, the overall experience is highly recommended, especially for those looking to enjoy a romantic or trendy evening. Reservations are encouraged to ensure a memorable visit.

source_info.name: Santa Barbara Harbor & Seafood Festival
source_info.categories: Food, Local Flavor, Seafood, Arts & Entertainment, Shopping, Festivals, Restaurants, Arts & Crafts

review_info.review_text: Beach shack for takeout on one side and casual dine-in restaurant on the other side.  We had the ceviche, albacore tuna melt and ahi tacos. All were very good and we'd get them again! Ordered the bartender special cocktail - good but a little pricey and served in a martini glass so not a lot of cocktail.  All in all, a fun place with decent food.

We flew to LAX 1 day before, and drove 2 hours from LA to Santa Barbara which is our trip main itinerary. There are several tents selling merchandise along from parking lot to pier. On the pier, you can get fresh sea urchin, crabs, and spiky lobsters. Lobsters each weighs over 1 lb to almost 2 lbs. You just hand picked and paid by the weight which they accept credit card. Then you proceed to cook station for fee of $5 and waited for about an hour. We also got a plate of paella, a cup of clam chowder for our lunch. Initially wanted to try fresh oysters a dozen for $25 but the line was too long. There's ceviche, taco, street corn, etc. Once we got our food, we settled down near the beach picnic table under palm trees. 

All and all, the experience was great. Enjoyed driving along beach despite the LA traffic.

Over crowded festival with overpriced food. I was mainly interested in tasting some fresh uni.  There were a couple of venders selling live uni but most of them had hardly any eggs in it.  I paid one for $15 and it was okay but not good enough to get another one.  The live fish and lobsters, after purchasing them, you have to take them to a different tent to cook for you and there was a long line.  I had to wait for 30 minutes for jambalaya shrimp which had four little shrimp and the rest was rice.   And it was too salty. Seafood paella looked good but again there was a long line.  Overall, I was very disappointed.  There was nothing special about this festival.  I can have live lobsters or crab at home anytime for much less price.  
.

Operating on Saturdays from 10:00 AM to 5:00 PM, the festival offers a diverse range of experiences, including casual dining, takeout, and a variety of seafood and arts activities. The festival attracts visitors with its extensive seafood offerings, such as fresh sea urchin, crabs, and lobsters, which can be handpicked and cooked on-site. However, some customers have noted overcrowding and long wait times, especially for popular dishes like lobster and seafood paella. Despite these challenges, many reviewers praise the food quality and the festive atmosphere, making it a fun and enjoyable experience for those interested in local flavors and seafood. The festival is well-suited for groups and offers a casual ambiance, though it lacks outdoor seating or WiFi. Overall, the Santa Barbara Harbor & Seafood Festival is a popular destination for those seeking a unique and memorable seafood experience.

review_info.review_text: My favorite sandwich spot in Goleta, hands down!! Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Only criticism would be that the wait time for a sandwich can be long sometimes, but it's because it's usually busy.
Love this place!!! The food is so good and amazing service every time. I highly recommend the chipotle Turkey club.

This is my second time trying this place and my first time at this location. The one in Paseo Nuevo is super disappointing and I thought this location might be better. It's not much. It is definitely cleaner and has a nicer atmosphere with nicer workers but the food is just not good. It smells and looks good but then you bite into it and it's like eating air with sauce. They rely on the sauce for flavor so they drench it. The chicken is always dry, overcooked, and flavorless, and the bread is stale and flavorless. They give good portions but it really isn't worth the money. It also does take quite a while to get you food no matter if it's busy or not, but I'm pretty understanding of that since I've worked in a restaurant before but for the wait, you would expect it to taste good.

review_info.review_text: Terrific!! Try the cinnamon roll French toast, STUPID GOOD! We ordered the quiche Lorraine and they were out of the ingredients so they made us a broccoli & cheddar quiche instead, WHOA!! AMAZING!! Don't miss this place when visiting Santa Barbara, we will be back!! WHAT A GEM!!

Oh man oh man. There's like 4 breakfast sandwiches that I've had over the years on my travels and I still think about them to this very day. Add Recipes to the list! The jalapeño cheddar biscuit breakfast sandwich is just ...*chef's kiss*. Located in a quaint Victorian home, this bakery offers the most tasty home baked goods. I also tried a cinnamon roll that deserves its props. I wish I could have bought one of everything. The owner was working hard all alone; you can tell he is a master at his craft. Already looking forward to my next trip back to SB.

This place is so cute! The bacon cheddar scone with homemade preserve, butter and homemade whipped cream is to die for!!! And it's gluten free. The icing on the cinnamon roll was superb and I'm usually not a cinnamon roll fan. And the fresh squeezed organs juice was very likely the best I have ever had!

response: Recipes Bakery & Gifts: An Australian Coffee House in Santa Barbara, CA, is a charming and highly-rated breakfast and brunch spot with a 4.5-star rating. While known for its delicious quiche Lorraine, the staff's ability to adapt and make a broccoli & cheddar quiche instead of the out-of-stock quiche Lorraine is a testament to their culinary excellence. review_info.review_text: Took a stop in Isla Vista and was craving bagels. The wait was maybe 7-10 minutes before ordering but so worth it. This place had such a wide selection of bagel sandwiches that it was hard to settle with the Earth, Wind, and Fire Bagel Sandwich. It was AMAZING! One was enough to share for two people. I was able to choose which bagel I wanted and ended with the Galaxy bagel! The siracha added a nice touch. Would love to return here.
Forgot to put bacon on bagel. I'm now very sad. Use this as a cautionary tale and do a bacon check before you leave! #Check4Bacon

The owner really needs to hire new people or train his employees enough to know that they're at work and not in class. 12/14/2021 I order two bagels & two hot chocolates for pickup. We get there about 3 minutes before estimated pick up, as we walk in there is a blonde white girl with a bag on her shoulder who glanced at us and went right back on her phone. We ask if our order is ready which we didnt expect it to be but still asked, and she grabs my two bagels each wrapped in one wrapper and placed on a random counter and my two hot chocolates the same. I nicely ask if they can rewarm them since they were left out for God knows how long, with the purse on her shoulder still she continues to work and make sandwhiches. After warming up the hot chocolates she slams it on the counter, i say thank you and she rolls her eyes and walks away. I'm outside drinking some of the hot chocolate in the nice rainy weather enjoying my time and I hear some elementary school style gossip going on inside of the business. The employees are hurdled up as the girl is telling them "oh they couldve warmed it up themselves " and continued not only gossiping about a customer right infront of them but also trying to state that we as customers should be doing her job?? I then nicely go in and let her know to next time wait for the customers to leave and then talk about them and right away she starts going off telling me i dont give a **** i dont care you can warm your own **** up and ended it up with a nice F U. As a business owner myself this is just embarrasing for the owner and knowing owners check their yelp reviews i know you'll see this. Extremely unproffesional and rude behavior and the county needs to go check on this business, employees watching tiktoks while customers are inside, slamming drinks and gossiping, working while having a purse on your shoulder. That absolutely flabbergasted me like seriously hire workers not jokes and clowns. Great bagels though !!

Jan 1 we arrived after we booked room with extra bed, because they advice us to do that while making reservation.We got air bad which was broken, 3 times over the night we asked for that solution, plus for pillow, sheets, blanket... did not work out because staff -guy has problem to understand any english words ( finally with sign language we explain him the different problemos)... long storry to final...- bed collapsed, noone responded, we lost any sleep at all, and finale come when we check out- after we told over and over what happend, lady ( without mask) did not charge us extra bed... Hallelujah - thanks for treat!!
The magic dissapeared... Also when we entered to reno room where you can not have any privace in the bathroom without door, with plastic outdoor shades inside (not protect lights from courtyard all nights) two towels for 3 people etc etc..list is not short...

Yes, it is still great location, cute hidden place with funky ideas, but the BASIC didn't work...
I'll try to understand their business policy without contacting any kind of inspection....

ANTI-FORMULAIC well-designed hotel, it was originally an Art-School founded in 1920 and is now a small boutique hotel with only 24 rooms but oozing with charm. The attention to detail is amazing from the welcoming tiles in the parking garage to the pleasant smell of flowers when you get on the elevator.

It has a perfect low-key appeal and design that feels "Santa Barbara" without the artificiality of primarily using white stucco and orange tiled roofs to fit local vibe like some fancy hotels in the area. Very cool place to stay and we loved it. The rooms are eclectic but memorable and we enjoyed resting in some of the public areas like the fireplace and fountain. 

The rooms have a GIANT bathtub for you to soak in and my wife was all chill and calm until she saw the shampoos, soap, and lotion were from "Diptique" and she went crazy texting her friends while I wondered why it felt slimy and made my eyes burn.

Location is tops, its easily walkable to some of the heavy-hitting sites and eateries in the Presido area, the longest we had to drive to anywhere else was 10 minutes.

Everyone that works here is extremely helpful and  friendly. Super clean and beautiful. But the best thing of all is that they really make your stay special. We are currently staying here for my girlfriends birthday and they wrote her a birthday note with chocolates and rose petals on the floor and bed such an amazing place with even better staff

response: Palihouse Santa Barbara is a charming, boutique hotel nestled in Santa Barbara, California, offering a mix of hotels, cafes, restaurants, and event planning services. Originally an Art School founded in 1920, it now boasts 24 unique, eclectic rooms, each with a giant bathtub and a focus on local vibes. The hotel features free WiFi, outdoor seating, and a welcoming atmosphere, making it a popular choice for both locals and tourists. However, service quality can vary, with some guests experiencing unprofessional and unresponsive staff, particularly with room issues and amenities. Despite these shortcomings, the hotel's prime location, beautiful design, and attention to detail continue to attract visitors. The Ambiance is described as perfect and the staff extremely helpful, with one guest noting that the hotel made their stay special with a thoughtful birthday surprise. Overall, while the experience can be mixed, the hotel's charm, cleanliness, and unique features make it a standout choice for those seeking a memorable stay in Santa Barbara.

source_info.name: Jeannine's American Bakery Restaurant
source_info.categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Coffee & Tea

review_info.review_text: I am super disappointed. I love the Jeannine's in Montecito. But this one is just not that great. Coffee is not great , I think the drink coffee is a good indicator on how serious a place takes their coffee and this place does not do great coffee. I ordered chilequiles and we super excited since I love that dish most places I go to but tbh it was the worst chilequiles I've ever had. The taste was bitter and even my dad who eats everything and is not picky didn't eat it. Also I asked specifically not to overlook my eggs, and they were overcooked. Bummer! Paid 7 for fresh OJ... also not tasty. Ordered French toast for my boy and it was definitely the best thing we ordered. I also got a croissant and I know this is brutal but Costco makes them better. Sorry guys I hate to be so negative but to spend 65 bucks on breakfast that was a MAJOR let down. I will not be going back.

Visiting from SF - this place is excellent. Don't be out off by it's location in a mall. 

The food and service are top notch and the decor inside is super cute. 

We had the French toast and Avo toast with matcha lattes made with oat milk. 

Everything was made perfectly and was really delicious. The eggs had deep Orange yolks and were also super tasty. 

Two thumbs up!

I absolutely love the ambiance, and the attentive service.
The french toast was delicious!
Fresh OJ gets a two thumbs up!
Now the bacon! I'd go there just for that! 
Smokey and crisp!
My friend had that All American and she was pleased!
Definitely on repeat! 
Thanks to everyone for a nice experience!

response:
Jeannine's American Bakery Restaurant, located at 7060 Hollister Ave, Ste 105 in Goleta, CA, offers a classic American breakfast and brunch experience with a classy and upscale ambiance. It features free WiFi, outdoor seating, and a take-out service.

One reviewer, who previously enjoyed the Montecito location, found the Goleta branch lacking in quality, particularly criticizing the coffee, chilequiles, and overcooked eggs. However, the French toast still received high praise, and the fresh OJ was noted as a standout.

Despite the mixed reviews, Jeannine's American Bakery Restaurant offers a reliable and enjoyable dining experience, particularly for those who appreciate classic American breakfast fare.

Meh.

The service was like whatevers, the waitress was kind of a noob and forgot about taking back the bill so i had to go up to the counter and pay there.

source_info.name: Paradise Cafe
source_info.categories: American (Traditional), American (New), Nightlife, Restaurants, Seafood, Cafes

review_info.review_text: Used to be one of my favorite places to frequent. Not anymore and they took my favorite item off the menu. Menu sucks now. But new owners don't care. That's why they will go out of business soon. Sorry but that's their choice. I'd give them a fat zero if I could. They suck.

This used to be our favorite restaurant in Santa Barbara. We went there in February 2020 after it was purchased by new owners. In short, it should no longer be called the Paradise Cafe as it bears no resemblance to the original restaurant. The food was mediocre. We ordered a salad which came undressed, looked like it had been prepared by a child, and had no flavor and a tiny piece of salmon. It as listed as an entree but was more like an appetizer portion. Burgers, which used to be fabulous, now taste terrible, with poor quality meat and fries so bad my kids would not eat them. A fried chicken appetizer was unedible.  This used to be a fantastic restaurant, with genuinely good food and wonderful service, in a laid back atmosphere. They've kept the name and nothing else. The food now tastes like something you could get at a college cafeteria or out of a Cisco-supplied chain restaurant. What a loss for Santa Barbara.

I loved the calamari appetizer! Super tasty and fun with a dip. Also the fried chicken was exceptional. The bar service was quick and Michelle took great care of us! Bloody Mary was on point. Definitely recommend!

response: Paradise Cafe is a traditional American restaurant located at 702 Anacapa St in Santa Barbara, CA, offering a range of dishes including seafood and American cuisine. With a business rating of 3.5 stars, the cafe attracts customers with its free WiFi, outdoor seating, and group-friendly atmosphere. However, recent customer reviews paint a mixed picture, highlighting a stark decline in quality post-ownership change. Older patrons lament the removal of favorite dishes, the poor quality of the new menu, and a lack of care from the new management. Despite the challenges, there are positive reviews praising the tasty calamari, excellent fried chicken, and quick bar service, particularly from staff like Michelle. Given the varied customer experiences, the Paradise Cafe's future as a beloved local spot remains uncertain.

review_info.review_text: I have to give this restaurant a 1-star rating purely due to horrible service. While the extremely pricey menu options were surprisingly good, the service in the whole restaurant was awful! Our server came to our table twice the entire night. Once to seat us, and once after we waited a very long time to get our check. He never came to check on us or ask how our food was even once! One table next to us even walked out before getting their food, or maybe they just never received it. A couple sat at the hostess stand for a good 10 mins before anyone greeted them as well. I'm surprised they didn't leave! It's too bad that the staff was so un attentive, because the food was actually pretty good! We will probably not be returning here:/

I frequent this location often on the weekends as a hang-out location with my friends. Over the many time I have been here, I have had a consistent experience with the food, the environment, as well as the service. 

When you open the menu, you will be quite surprised at the wide variety of choices available. Dishes range from crab-cakes to artichoke dips to filet mignons. Personally, I have tried the steaks many times at Holdrens, as well as a few of their select appetizers. The food is good for the price, typically around $20-$30 per individual (Combination of entree and appetizer). To me, having frequented many steakhouses in the United States such as Mastro's and Strip House, I would have to say that the quality and presentation of the slab of meat is on par with my expectations. It might be a little bit on the high side in terms of the food, but what can you expect, it is Santa Barbara. I expect the price to be more catered to the location when looking at the prices. Overall, I was happy with my food because it was delicious and I left the restaurant a happy customer. 

Many people on Yelp have been complaining about the poor service and lack of attention they received during their experience. During my few times at Holdren's, I have yet to encounter any problems. The service is excellent and attentive, and my table was always served and cared for properly. 

Overall, my experience at Holdren's was pleasant. I understand that it is located near Santa Barbara, which is prime real-estate. I expect many restaurants to institute a premium in their prices because of this. As a happy customer, I will continue to frequent this location with my friends when I do have the chance.

My family went there for my brother's birthday. The wait staff was polite and courteous but the food was terrible. The steaks were burnt and the fish was undercooked. My mom and I split the bill and they ended up charging me for the entire bill!  I spoke with the manager a few days later and she said she would refund the portion I didn't owe, and instead CHARGED me again. Thank god I had enough money in my account to cover the charges. My bill was $86 and instead I got charged twice for a total of $411.08. Ridiculous, they lost me and my family's business forever.

review_info.review_text: The Walnut Gorgonzola salad never disappoints. Ordered with a scoop of chicken salad, it is the perfect meal. The mixed greens are fresh with the proper ratio of walnuts and Gorgonzola. The chicken salad is tasty and tender, but seems to be lacking in something for added flavor, a little lemon or dill perhaps for some added zest. Ordering is easy, and there is ample dining outdoors. Fresco Cafe is definitely on my go to list for a delicious meal.

I've eaten at Fresco on and off for the past 15 years. I stopped by on 12/30 at 4:30 pm to pick up a quick order of fries, soup and desserts. After paying, I walked by the open kitchen to wait for my order and noticed that one of the cooks was NOT WEARING A MASK and was USING HIS HANDS TO EAT WHILE ALSO PREPPING FOOD IN THE KITCHEN. I was shocked, especially based upon the skyrocketing COVID cases in the past few days. I spoke with the manager and asked for a refund. He was very nice but explained that this was his first shift and he did not know how to issue a refund. I asked for the contact information for the owner and he was unable to provide this (said they were out of business cards). He promised me that if I left my number someone would contact me.

Really great locals joint... used to live/work nearby and would eat here almost every day. Huge selection of different types of food, good cupcakes & chocolate cake, Arnold Palmer unlimited refills, friendly & efficient staff! Delicious salads the Gorgonzola walnut is classic. Their Saturday special Jack Daniels ribs & fries with Dijon are phenomenal. Best ribs in town with Carlitos. A terrific spot where you'll always know what to expect. The wraps are delicious as well. Pretty sure they have largest, most diverse salad selection in town. Their Ahi club is all worldly see photo. French club sandwiches are so half assed. Frescos is quality & savoir faire in club sandwich department.

source_info.name: Killer B's BBQ Bar and Grill
source_info.categories: Sports Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife, Bars, Food, Barbeque, American (Traditional)

review_info.review_text:
This place gets 5 stars on all fronts. The server we had was genuine and friendly. We sat on the patio with our dog and despite it being chilly she made sure to check on is often. All of the food was exceptional. I ordered the brisket which is amazing. It falls apart in your mouth and has a fantastic flavor thanks to the 15 hours of slow cooking. My boyfriend got a half rack of ribs which were equally tender and delicious. The owner came out and spoke to us several times and even treated our dog to some of the fabulous brisket. 

If you are looking for exceptional BBQ at a place with a down-to-earth staff this is it. We live in Ventura buy we will definitely be back.

Love this place! Always loved the food as they truly due have Killer BBQ. From pulled pork sandwiches to tri-tip the food is always a win. Now with the new location with the huge dog friendly patio, I think I just found my new favorite spot to watch a game, have a beer or a great meal. Looking forward to going there again and again!

Killer B's IS OPEN - 731 De La Guerra Plaza!  It quietly reopened earlier in December and is well worth searching out at its new location inside De La Guerra Plaza across from City Hall.  Entrance is through the brightly-lit, large patio with plenty of tables (each complete with a full paper towel dispenser - they don't mess around) and heaters for cooler evenings.  For the sports fans there are flatscreen TVs on the exterior walls with volume off or very low for the dinner-conversation fans.  The inside dining area looked warm and inviting.  My two friends and I sat outside and witnessed the BBQ items being removed from the gigantic smoker in the corner of the patio; proof positive this is REAL, slow-cooked BBQ, not baked, as previously mentioned by a person with a wooden "pallet."  We were told the menu selection will expand once they get their rhythm and flow going with the new kitchen, a wise strategy to keep quality of food and service high.  The juicy pulled-pork sandwich was loaded and stacked tall, and got a big thumbs up.  The baby back ribs were meaty, tender, and moist, with knock-out flavor.  Those last remaining, tasty crisp bits clinging to the bone make one want to pick off every last morsel, so give yourself time to really work those ribs.  The rub and smoke flavors are well balanced with just the right amount of sweetness, tang, and rich carmelized goodness in the sauce.  My buddy, who is very particular about his beans, said the baked beans were delicious.  My side of green beans and corn was cooked just enough to leave a little crunch with nice roasted flavor.  Our server was very friendly and attentive.  Two of us were allowed to split a full rack of ribs and our 1-free-entree Axxess card deal was honored with a smile - gotta love that!  The owner, Will, visited with us for a while and told us of his plans for the new location and future events, all of which sound great. My dinner mates and I are slow-cook BBQ fans and are so happy to have a place in Santa Barbara that does it right.  Next time there is live music in De La Guerra plaza, I will find a table there and enjoy what the full bar has to offer.  We hope Killer B's kills it in the new location so we can continue to enjoy local BBQ that is the real deal.

response: Killer B's BBQ Bar and Grill is a charming and highly-rated sports bar and restaurant located at 718 State St in Santa Barbara, CA. Known for its exceptional BBQ and casual atmosphere, the restaurant offers a wide range of menu items, including slow-cooked brisket, ribs, and tri-tip, all prepared with 15 hours of slow cooking to ensure tenderness and rich flavor. The down-to-earth staff is genuinely friendly and accommodating, with a particular focus on dog-friendly seating, as evidenced by the reviews that highlight the warm welcome for patrons with their pets. The new location inside De La Guerra Plaza features a large, brightly-lit patio with plenty of seating and heaters, as well as flat-screen TVs for sports fans. The restaurant offers free WiFi, outdoor seating, and reservations, making it an ideal spot for groups and families. With a 4-star business rating and numerous 5-star reviews, Killer B's is a must-visit for anyone looking to enjoy high-quality BBQ and a relaxed, enjoyable dining experience in Santa Barbara.

RIP European Deli. I really enjoyed you.

I agree with the review below me and although this restaurant may be long gone, I still need to leave 5 stars review for European deli!

This was a family owned business. The older lady that was in charge was so nice and she was very patient with me as I slowly browsed through all their menu and each and every single type of sausage they had. My boyfriend opted for the bratwurst combo meal and I always got their sandwich. I forgot what kind of sandwich I got but I remember it being super good. I really wish European deli would open up again. :( I was so broken hearted when I found out they closed.. still reminiscing even though I'm 100 miles away! Hope the family that ran the restaurant is doing well!

I don't think I have ever been more disappointed to hear of a restaurant closing. It deserves a final review as having the very best German potato salad and roast beef I have ever had. I am still trying to find someplace in LA/OC even close. Let me know if anyone has a favorite place.

review_info.review_text:
I was so hungry and craving Japanese food so I was super excited there was a Sakura right next to Swarovski where I work!

But the portion was super teeny and it didn't make me full at all :( I got a beef teriyaki bowl, which was delicious, but it was $10 and I'm still hungry right now.

The employees are nice and the food is good though!

I really need to stop assuming restaurants have online menus and take more pictures of menus. Sigh. Anyway, my mum and I came here for lunch when we were checking out the Paseo Nuevo Shopping Center in SB. As usual, this is a Japanese restaurant owned by Koreans. The lady behind the counter was really friendly but the male employee (co-owner?) was definitely less so. We ordered at the counter and were given a number for our order. The food is a bit pricey, but my mum wanted Asian food so this is where we ended up. Since it was a nice day, we took a seat at a table on the patio and waited for our food and water to be brought to us.

When the lady took our order, she had asked if we wanted anything to drink. I told her two waters, please, and she acknowledged my request. And yet the water never came... not cool.

After a while, the male employee brought us our food. My mum had gotten the Beef Curry Bowl and I got the Dragon Roll. He also brough us utensils and one napkin each. He dropped my napkin on the floor, so he picked it up and walked away. I thought he was going to bring me another napkin, but he didn't. We chalked it up to him being weird and also very unfriendly. Is he the same unfriendly owner that the other Yelpers have been ranting about? While he wasn't outright rude to us, I can totally picture him being rude to customers.

As for the food... my roll was okay. It wasn't great, it wasn't bad, it was just fine. But my mum did not like her beef curry bowl at all. She thought the meat was mediocre and the curry was bland. She was not a fan of the food at all. While I don't think this place merits just one star, at least not in my experience, they definitely can't get higher than two stars, since they really were just meh.

Not worth one dollar I paid! Half my food was cold, small portion for the $$ and dirty place. Our table was cleaned with a rag that smelled badly, food took A LONG TIME to arrive at our table. Avoid this place if possible!

review_info.review_text: wait..this is the greek italian deli... and there closed... that sucks... i cant even explain how good the food was... the hot pastrami was unmatched!!! it was a family run spot since the beginning...and everyone was friendly as fuck!!!

Sadly, the Italian and Greek deli has closed its doors forever as of April 14, 2007. I was there myself, picking up a meatball sub soon after they'd opened for business. If it's any testament to their popularity, I saw the lunch queue 30 people deep the Thursday before they closed, and the shop had about 50 people in it within 5 minutes of opening on their last Saturday.  My meatball sub was delicious.
This store was open for business for 36 years, my mother recalls this was the only place she could buy phyllo pastry way back when. For me, I liked the shop because it was the first in Santa Barbara to carry halloumi cheese. 
Quelle bummer to lose the Italian and Greek deli! But life goes on.

The pastrami sandwich is well, the best I've ever had.  It's all warmly scrumptious and peppery and toasty and goo-ily provoloney and has pickles and pepperoncinis and is totally EPIC in its proportions (must be the Greek side of things). Mmmm....Even Carnegie Deli doesn't do it as well as these guys-different part of the country, but still... 

Killer Greek Salad (dolmas anyone?), various marinated olive selection in their case, and major bonus points for deviled egg option as well. The meatball sando hits the spot. But it's the GYRO that makes my tastebuds gyrate (I've never tried the cluck, but the lamb/beef dynamic option is fantastic). This is just about the best lunch in town, and you're home free with a big ol' Pellegrino and chips for less than 10 bucks. One of my favorite spots for sure. A fun stop on Farmer's Market Tuesday evenings!

Customers praised the sandwiches for their generous portions, perfect balance of flavors, and the deli's commitment to quality ingredients. The deli's friendly atmosphere and family-run spirit were highlighted in multiple reviews, with customers expressing deep regret over its closure. Despite its closure, the Italian & Greek Delicatessen remains a cherished memory for many, leaving a lasting impact on the Santa Barbara community.

review_info.review_text: Really cute bar situated in downtown Santa Barbara. I did not sit inside where the pianos are at, but sat outside (outside seating/patio area is available right on the street post Covid). Only downfall was there is no food offered; so you can only stay so long.
Met my future wife here.  We had an amazing night listening to music in the awesome ambiance.  Very entertaining.
Cool atmosphere.  Fun piano bar vibe with sing alongs. Bartenders are sociable and attentive. The cocktails were not to my liking.  They were good but could have had a little more love in them.

response:
The Red Piano, located at 519 State St in Santa Barbara, CA, is a charming and ambitious venue that embodies the essence of a sophisticated piano bar. With a 4.5-star rating, this establishment stands out for its elegant and classy atmosphere, perfect for both solo visits and group outings. The outdoor seating area, available during the day, adds a casual and enjoyable vibe, especially after the challenges of post-Covid times.

The Red Piano offers a vibrant nightlife with live music and a relaxed environment, making it a popular spot for socializing and enjoying the local culture. While the cocktails are generally well-received, some reviewers noted that the drinks could be more flavorful. Despite this minor criticism, the bar's overall atmosphere, from the lively piano performances to the attentive bartenders, remains highly praised.

The venue is equipped with free WiFi and offers parking options, including a street parking area. While it lacks food and reservation services, The Red Piano is a must-visit for those seeking an upscale, intimate setting with a touch of romance and a vibrant, entertaining atmosphere.

source_info.name: Crushcakes Cafe & Simply Pies
source_info.categories: Restaurants, Bakeries, Cafes, Coffee & Tea, Food, Desserts

review_info.review_text:
My first review of Crushcakes was for the vegan blueberry scone, which let me tell you is super duper. Now, I've been coming to this location almost weekly for several months to study, and I'm updating my review--but not my 5-star rating. With a cute back patio, a customer loyalty punch card, and lovely vegan baked goods (cinnamon and blueberry scones and a variety of cupcakes) as well as full meals and fresh, hot coffee (be sure to ask for it in a "for here" cup if you're staying!) I'm crushing on Crushcakes. 

This morning, employees Dana, Niku, and Katey were especially helpful. My small coffee with a splash of oat milk ($3) hit the spot in the chilly weather. As a vegan, I love the fact that Crushcakes doesn't upcharge for plant-based milks. My only critique is that the wifi is touch-and-go, especially on the back patio, and there aren't any exterior outlets. But with a fully-charged computer and digital text to read, the back is a great spot to get some work done or gather for a Covid-safer breakfast or lunch. Big picnic-style tables provide ample room for studying too. Thanks Crushcakes!

I have been buying cupcakes from Crushcakes for many years, mostly at the Santa Barbara location, and they have always been yummy...moist, flavorful, and my absolute favorite cupcakes ever. Today my husband brought home several of the "mini" cupcakes for me (from the Goleta location).  It had been a while since I had treated myself to a Crushcake, and I was so excited!  I had asked for the Red Velvet and Vanilla Bean flavors, but found when I opened the box that, although my husband had specifically ordered Red Velvet cupcakes, there were none to be found.  They were plain chocolate.  And they were *super* dry.  The Vanilla Bean cupcakes were also dry, and the frosting didn't even reach the level of the frosting you find in supermarket bakeries.  I am so sad and disappointed! Hoping I can still find the deliciousness I remember at the Santa Barbara location!

The staff at Crushcakes were so helpful, I wanted to try everything (and one can, if one has 8 stomachs). Their cupcake of the day, the scrumptious mocha, was a party on my palate. Perfectly moist and flavorful. This confectionary gem is a fantastic choice for cupcakes and pies to boot! Crushcakes is a must and that's the sweet and honest tooth.

response:
Crushcakes Cafe & Simply Pies is a charming, casual cafe located in Goleta, CA, offering a delightful blend of baked goods, coffee, and full meals. The cafe boasts a 3.5-star rating on platforms like Google and Yelp, with a variety of vegan baked goods, including cinnamon and blueberry scones and a range of cupcakes. It also serves full meals and fresh, hot coffee, with options for takeout and on-site dining. The outdoor patio is a cozy spot for studying or casual gatherings, and the cafe provides free Wi-Fi, though it can be intermittent.

Customers praise the cafe's helpful staff, such as employees Dana, Niku, and Katey, and the quality of their vegan baked goods and coffee. The cafe is known for its friendly atmosphere and is a great spot for groups, particularly for those who are vegan, as they do not charge extra for plant-based milks. However, some customers have expressed disappointment with the inconsistency in cupcake quality and the lack of exterior outlets. Despite these minor issues, Crushcakes remains a popular choice for both casual and more formal dining experiences, making it a must-visit for those in the area.

source_info.categories: Desserts, Gelato, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food, Cafes, Restaurants

review_info.review_text: I just checked my credit card after reading the many horrible comments about the owner adding his own tip and even though I gave him $0 on the receipt, he added his own $3 tip. This place is an absolute disgrace. DO NOT GO HERE.

Inedible ice cream. My ice cream tasted like water and was icy and melted. The owner looked miserable and was upset when he gave me the wrong ice cream and when I said I ordered pumpkin he rolled his eyes. He did not wear gloves and the ice cream cone did not have a paper wrapping. His fingers were bloody and he had dirt under his finger nails. I was grossed out when he handed me the ice cream and I had to throw the entire thing out. Disgusting. This store is completely unsanitary. DO NOT GO. He did not even wear a mask

Upon walking into Here's the Scoop with my mother and two daughter's we were excited to try a scoop of gelato in the quaint town of Montecito. We walked in and smiled and said hello to the owner an older man who did not respond or greet us upon arrival. He looked miserable and we didn't feel welcome at all. Even my toddler noticed that he wasn't friendly. There weren't any seats to sit outside so we opted to sit inside as I had my two younger children with me. The entire time we were sitting inside it was extremely awkward and quite. For it being an ice cream shop you would expect some cheerfulness. Not here. I also noticed he gave himself a three dollar tip which I did NOT authorize. I wouldn't have normally disputed a charge like this but it's the principle. He definitely has a reputation for this after reading all of his bad reviews. Please DO NOT support this small business.

response:
Here's the Scoop, located at 1187 Coast Village Rd in Montecito, CA, is a desserts, gelato, and ice cream shop that has received a low rating of 3.5 stars. The business offers a range of sweet treats and is popular for takeout and group dining, though it lacks WiFi and outdoor seating. The hours of operation are generally from 12:00 PM to 10:00 PM, with extended hours on weekends.

However, customer reviews paint a starkly negative picture. Several reviews highlight poor customer service, with the owner often appearing unhappy and unapproachable. One reviewer noted that the owner added a $3 tip to their bill without authorization, which was particularly upsetting. The ice cream quality is also criticized, with multiple reviewers describing it as inedible, icy, and poorly presented. Hygiene concerns are prominent, with one reviewer pointing out the owner's dirty hands and lack of mask-wearing, leading to the discard of a purchased cone. The overall ambiance is described as awkward and unwelcoming, with the shop feeling cold and uncaring.

In summary, while Here's the Scoop offers a variety of desserts and a convenient takeout service, the poor service, hygiene issues, and customer complaints make it a less than ideal choice for anyone seeking a pleasant and welcoming ice cream experience.

review_info.review_text: It was the worst fish n chips I've ever had. I believe the fish was tilapia as it tasted muddy. We felt disgusted after eating there. It's worst than the frozen fish from the grocery store.

Nice stop on the pier for coffee

This is a no frills, no fuss, coffee shop (but also serves  food?!) right on the edge of the pier.  It looks like they are not getting extremely high marks for food, but if you go into the place it doesn't feel like a spot for a gourmet meal. What it is great for, and why I'm giving it four stars, is because of the beautiful view over the pier.  It has some awesome seating on the rail, right outside. I suggest going there early in the morning, maybe even for sunrise, and getting a coffee. I also grabbed a bagel, toasted with cream cheese. It felt like a Bagel experience you would have at Starbucks or coffee bean. 

Stop in for the coffee and the views!

Absolutely my favorite spot for breakfast in Santa Barbara! Casual outdoor dining area on Stearns wharf with absolutely gorgeous view of the ocean and the hills of Santa Barbara. Francisco, Blanca and the rest of the staff are always friendly and offer excellent service. They serve a range of espresso drinks, and a nice breakfast (and lunch) menu. My personal favorite is the huevos rancheros.  A great place to eat and appreciate the beauty of Santa Barbara.

response: Char West, located at 221 Stearns Wharf in Santa Barbara, California, is a versatile eatery that offers a range of dining experiences, including fish and chips, American cuisine, and coffee. Despite this, the restaurant offers friendly service and a scenic outdoor dining area with a view of the ocean and the Santa Barbara hills. It is suitable for groups and is a favorite spot for breakfast, with a menu that includes espresso drinks, huevos rancheros, and other dishes.

source_info.name: Uniboil
source_info.categories: Food, Bubble Tea, Chinese, Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Hot Pot

review_info.review_text:
I ate here three times already.

Parking is easy; there are plenty of spaces. They have both indoor and outdoor dining. The restaurant is connected to Phresh Tea (located on the right), and both use the same kitchen, so you can order Boba or anything on Phresh Tea menu while dining at Uniboil. 

Uniboil are known for their hotpots. They also have other dishes on the menu if you're not into that. The prices are reasonable, and the hotpot portion is huge; you could probably share it with another person if you aren't too hungry. 

I really enjoyed the Beef Thai Tom Yum Hotpot. I've also had the Korean Army Stew the first time my family and I went, and it was good; I do prefer the Thai one better though. I've tried the sizzling beef dish (forgot what is called), popcorn chicken, and beef noodle soup. Sizzling beef and popcorn chicken were fantastic. I didn't like the beef noodle soup. The broth tasted fine, but the meats were terrible. I didn't have any meats in my bowl actually; it was like just fatty parts. 

Customer service has been inconsistent; sometimes they're slow, and other times they're quick. Staffs are friendly though. They checked up on us all the time.

Their boba drink is surprisedly good, I have a high standard for boba, their boba is definitely above average. Try their kumquat drink, or milk drink with less sweet ( it could be really sweet ). As for their food, I ordered a noodle soup for my son, the soup is good but not the round noodle they use. Order their drink if you visit.

Felt weird vibes here. Was confused that it was also attached to the tea place next door and all the workers were more situated there. Thus it was a while and took effort to get a table at the restaurant side. Even tho there was only one other party there... 

We came for the beef noodle soup and coffee. The soup Is the first picture on Yelp and looked delicious. But upon ordering the waitress said they didn't have it. They had run out. Plus they didn't have coffee either. At the end we decided not to stay

response: Uniboil is a trendy and casual Asian fusion restaurant located at 5599 Hollister Ave, Unit C in Goleta, CA. Offering a wide range of dishes including bubble tea, hot pot, and Chinese cuisine, Uniboil stands out for its reasonable prices and generous portion sizes, particularly its large hotpot that can be shared by two. The restaurant, connected to Phresh Tea, features both indoor and outdoor seating, making it a great spot for groups and those looking for a relaxed ambiance. Parking is available in a nearby lot, and free Wi-Fi is provided. Customer service can be inconsistent, with some slow and others quick, but staff are generally friendly and attentive. Despite some mixed reviews, Uniboil's food, especially the Beef Thai Tom Yum Hotpot and sizzling beef, is highly praised, while the beef noodle soup received mixed feedback. Overall, Uniboil is a popular and enjoyable dining experience for those who appreciate Asian fusion cuisine.

review_info.review_text: Nice change of pace for a quick bite to eat. Tri-tip and Reuben Piadinas were tasty and reasonably priced.

When you're sitting in the salon getting your hair done a couple of doors down, its lunch time, and you want a yummy  wrap that encompasses all of the ingredients of a reuben sandwich, you come to Montecito Deli and order the Reuben Piadina! The warm piadini fits perfectly into your hand. Once you bite into it, you get all the layers of the reuben sandwich bursting into your mouth! The pastrami perfectly seasoned,  the sauerkraut with just the right amount of sour and tart, and the pickle, tomatoes, and thousand island dressing. And we can't forget that yummy Swiss cheese that's perfectly melted.
Jeff (the owner) and his guys are the best...food is great too We work right next door and are lucky to have them as neighbors!

Customers praise the restaurant for its delicious Tri-tip and Reuben Piadinas, which are both reasonably priced and popular among locals and visitors alike. The restaurant has received an average rating of 4.5 stars and is highly recommended for those seeking a casual, enjoyable dining experience.

source_info.name: Pastavino
source_info.address: Camino Real Marketplace, 6920 Market Pl Dr

review_info.review_text: I took my family here after reading some of the reviews from my fellow yelpers but we were unimpressed. We ordered garlic bread, a focaccia urger, kids mac and cheese, and spaghetti with meatballs. The garlic bread was okay but didn't really taste like garlic. The mac and cheese was gritty and extremely hot when they served it (which I would prefer to cold but my 3 year old wasn't too happy about having to wait to eat it). We can usually tell if we are going to like an italian restaurant based on their red sauce and I would have to say it was just okay. The focaccia burger was also just okay. I don't think we'll try it again.

It's amazing this restaurant is still open.  They have a really good beet salad, but the restaurant is almost always empty.  They recently took down an overhead portion above the bar and it's really lightened the place up.  I like the booths which give you the ability to have a private conversation and they're comfortable.  The bread is okay.  They often have coupons in the paper for buy one, get one free and that's what makes it worth coming back for (and I really like the beet salad).

I love this restaurant! From beginning to end we had an excellent experience.  Casey our waiter was attentive and friendly.  We had italian sodas and we were so happy to get a huge carafe of refills, then we had delicious garlic bread and salad.  The portions are big and we shared a salad and it was plenty for two.  We had the ahi and it was tasy, followed by the penne pasta which we also shared and they kindly split our entrees into two plates for us.  The finale was the s'mores dessert which is fun and delicious.  We were visiting from out of town or I would frequent this restaurant.  Casey made us want for nothing and I so appreciate good service AND good food, that makes for a great dining experience!

source_info.name: 1114 Sports Bar & Games
source_info.categories: Beer Bar, Sports Bars, Pubs, Bars, Restaurants, Cocktail Bars, Gastropubs, Nightlife, Tapas Bars

review_info.review_text: My buddies and I come here all the time for food and drinks whilst watching the football. Sadly they've recently increased their prices exponentially (salmon dish increased more than $10!). We like the spot but the prices are getting out of control.

Sadly didn't eat here. Apparently they were having issues with their reservation system so they weren't sure where to seat us. Initially the hostess told us she could sit us up stairs but we'd have to order at the bar. Then she switched things up and sat us at a long table but it was super crowded so we tried upstairs. We quickly abandoned that as it didn't seem like it would be enjoyable. We decided to leave. As we were leaving the other person waiting on a table because of a messed up reservation was sitting at a table downstairs. Not really sure why we weren't offered that table or the other empty one we saw. It was a playoff game day so I understand that they were busy but I got the impression they were a complete mess not ready to handle that many people. My wife did say the food looked good. Maybe we'll try again next time where in SB.

For being a sports bar, this place gets 5 stars for location, classiness, affordability, and excellent service. You can really sense that they work as a team here; the host, server, and busboy were all gracious and attentive. The food was surprisingly affordable and tasty. I was expecting greasy bar food, but they also have salads, brussel sprouts and an affordable salmon dish. Two appetizers, a sparkling rose, chicken Cesar salad and an entire salmon meal ended up being around $80+tip. 

I loved the gas fireplace on each outdoor table that pumped out heat, and I loved the sound of the water overlooking the turtle pond. I felt so happy resting and dining here, it is a quiet and quaint spot off State Street.

response:
1114 Sports Bar & Games, located at 1114 State St in Santa Barbara, CA, is a vibrant sports bar and gastropub that offers a wide range of dining options and entertainment. The bar is open from 11:00 AM to 9:00 PM on most days, with extended hours on weekends. It provides free Wi-Fi, outdoor seating, and a validated parking garage, and is known for its team-oriented service, making it a popular spot for groups and individuals alike.

Customer reviews highlight the bar's strengths, particularly its excellent service and diverse menu, which includes salads, brussel sprouts, and an affordable salmon dish. The ambiance is described as classy and trendy, with a gas fireplace and a serene water feature overlooking a turtle pond, creating a cozy and relaxing atmosphere.

However, there are also mixed reviews. Some customers complain about recent price increases, noting that a salmon dish has become significantly more expensive. Others mention issues with the reservation system, especially during busy times like playoff games, leading to a less than ideal dining experience. Despite these challenges, 1114 Sports Bar & Games remains a highly regarded spot in Santa Barbara, offering a unique blend of sports entertainment, good food, and a welcoming environment.

The leche de tigre and ceviches are amazing

source_info.name: Petros Restaurant
source_info.categories: Greek, Restaurants, Mediterranean, Food, Beer, Wine & Spirits, American (New)

review_info.review_text: We called the restaurant, and it went to a greeting, then checked the website, and made a reservation on OpenTable for 10 of us. Got to the restaurant and, surprise, surprise, it was closed!!!! If you are going to have a website, a phone greeting, or an OpenTable listing for your business, show the customers at least a little courtesy and put some sort of notice when you are not going to be open.

I was dying to go here (We'd been to the Petros in Solvang a while back and being an optimist, imagined it would be the same or better). On a recent visit to SB, we went in for dinner. First of all, the service was outstanding--warm and welcoming, eager and friendly, very caring and kind people, from the hostess to our server to the manager--everyone was so very sweet, it made up for our letdown with the food. To be fair, we live in the Bay Area with Kokkari in S.F. and Evvia in Palo Alto, and we'd had an unbelievable time at Petros Solvang--so we went in with expectations off the chart. Maybe this was the problem--it wasn't that their food was intrinsically bad; it was good. It just didn't sparkle, didn't blow our minds . . . the watermelon and feta salad was good, albeit not super alive with flavor. The grilled octopus was a good dose of protein, though with slightly muddled flavor (we were expecting it to be charred and tender), which is a tough call for octopus. While we were looking over the menu, we didn't see lamb listed, and were expressing disappointment to each other. Our server who had not yet come to our table, and was doing something else at the adjacent table, overheard us, and came over to reassure. He was just so sweet: going over not one or two, but three different lamb options. I mean, seriously, what kind of Greek restaurant doesn't have lamb, right? Petros had terrific lamb options: we had the lamb loin or was it the chops? They were good; again, not so memorable that I'd track down a postcard and write home about them. But they were good enough that we scarfed down everything :-) At some point during our dinner, someone spilled water everywhere near our table on the floor, and the manager was on top of it, asking someone to mop it up (before we tripped). We didn't stay for dessert, but I'd give anything to live near Petros, and I could go in for lunch anytime, we'd have a ball. Btw, the next day we were having dinner across the street at sunset, and Petros was the site for an outdoor wedding party/reception. We watched a gorgous and touching show--traffic stopped on the street while the bride and groom took photos, her white train trailing the street, veil blowing in the breeze . . . I damn near cried.
Awesome food and service! Just got back from Greece and this restaurant met our expectations of traditional Greek dishes.

response: Petros Restaurant, located at 1316 State St in Santa Barbara, CA, is a charming Greek restaurant that offers a romantic and intimate dining experience. The restaurant is well-received for its outstanding service, with reviewers praising the warm and friendly staff, including the hostess, server, and manager. However, one notable issue is the restaurant's scheduling transparency, as a review highlights a closure that could have been communicated better. Despite this, patrons appreciate the high-quality food and the attention to detail, such as promptly addressing a spill during their visit. The restaurant offers traditional Greek dishes and has several lamb options, which are generally well-received. While some reviewers, particularly those with Greek roots, might find the food not as memorable as they expected, the atmosphere and service make up for any slight disappointments. Overall, Petros Restaurant is a pleasant dining spot, especially for groups and those seeking a romantic evening out.

review_info.review_text:
This restaurant focuses on small plates; burgers, sandwiches and all the fixings in small (and inexpensive) easy to sample or share plates. 

Cheese burger - perfectly hits the spot. What're can I say; I was craving a cheeseburger and this one delivered. 
Fries - thin and crisp, the way I like them. 
Tater tots - a bit under-seasoned but good. 
Chicken Pot pie - definitely a show stealer. Highly recommend eating with the fries; kind if like fries and gravy. 
Shrimp sandwich - so far the only low point. A single shrimp butterflied and served on a sandwich. Good, but nothing I couldn't do on a lazy afternoon at home. 
Turkey burger - heavy in the seasoning and quite tasty. 
Berry crisp - another show stealer. Not what I was expecting, and definitely was very happy to order it, and will again without hesitation. 
Dark chocolate frozen banana pieces - pretty much the same as I make at home on hot summer afternoons. Nothing to write home about.

Went here on a Friday night, only 3 tables had people and 2 people at the bar.  There was no one to seat us.  Finally the guy from the bar came to seat us.  They wanted to seat us next to the bathroom.  We asked to be seated elsewhere and they gave us another table in the empty restaurant.  We sat down, and waited and waited and waited.  We were never offered to order anything, so we got up and left.  We should've known the reason it was empty is the service is bad, maybe their food is good but I'll never know.

I am glad I'm finally getting around to this review. I went here in a pleasant October evening after a few drinks at OKR, craving some late night eats and pleasant company. While service at the bar was slow and relatively inattentive I was able to get my order in of an old fashioned, the wild boar slider, onion rings, and Mac and cheese. First, the bad. Never, ever, ever list a menu item as truffle (blank) if you are just going to use truffle oil. It tastes like stale olive oil and chemicals. Also, use some sharp cheese. The creaminess was on point, but the flavor of the cheese was overwhelmed by the pungent odder of the truffle oil. The next, the mediocre. The onion rings were more onion straws, but semantics and preference aside, not bad. They weren't greasy, and for $3.50 served up quite the plate. But the highlight of the meal (and the warrant for 5 stars) was the wild boar slider and the expertly crafted old fashioned. The slider was juice, porky, and a pleasant several bites that I couldn't imagine tasting better. The patty was juicy and sumptuous, leaving little more to be desired. No condiments needed. The old fashioned was strong and Smokey, perfect for a chilly night and paired with the boar perfectly. I will (and have) returned frequently for your small, yet satisfying, bites of perfection. Just hold the truffle oil next time.

response:
The Pan in Santa Barbara is a charming tapas and comfort food restaurant located at 18 E Cota St. The restaurant offers a variety of small plates, including burgers, sandwiches, and hearty dishes like chicken pot pie and shrimp sandwiches, all at an affordable price. The ambiance is casual, and the restaurant accommodates groups well, making it a popular spot for both casual dining and special occasions. While some dishes are highly praised, such as the cheeseburger and berry crisp, others, like the shrimp sandwich, may not meet everyone's expectations.

Despite its strong points, The Pan also faces some criticism regarding service, particularly during busy times. One review highlights a negative experience with slow service and an uninviting seating arrangement, while another praises the restaurant's attentive service and exceptional taste in its small, shareable plates.

Overall, The Pan offers a delightful dining experience with a diverse menu and a casual, friendly atmosphere, though some inconsistencies in service may affect the overall experience.

review_info.review_text:
Great family owned business. Delicious food and service. Quant outdoor patio. 
Highly recommend.

Part of me feels bad writing this, because COVID has clearly been hard on them and I want them to succeed as a family restaurant in Carp. But, hopefully this inspires them to improve.

The food was excellent, but the service was strange. Our server started out sweet but soon became patronizing and made us uncomfortable. For example, we were told we can't have Parmesan cheese for the table because "the cheese is from Italy" (okay, what does that have to do with anything?). Then when she did stand over our plates spooning (not grating) the cheese into our dishes, she scolded us for wanting too much. Even if she was joking, we all felt weird. Also, when we made our reservation, THEY asked us if there was any special occasion. I said "yes, actually, a 10 year anniversary" - they even said happy anniversary to us when we arrived. But then...nothing happened. Which, whatever, but why do you ask if there is a special occasion if you're not going to do anything?? There were a few other weird things but not worth going into.

The server was the part owner, and maybe she was just out of her element and filling in for servers. But her table-side manner could be better. 

On a positive note, the food was excellent and the other staff members were very friendly.

Back again....flavor was great and the owner told us on way in "hey, kitchen is already backed up tonight so service will be slow, if you're looking to get in and out unfortunately try another night." Thank you for telling me! That set clear expectations and I wasn't anxious or annoyed waiting. 

Food was great and I love the atmosphere.

source_info.passages:
passage 1:1 Take shorter showers. 2  Replace you showerhead with an ultra-low-flow version. 3  Some units are available that allow you to cut off the flow without adjusting the water temperature knobs. 4  Use the minimum amount of water needed for a bath by closing the drain first and filling the tub only 1/3 full.

passage 2:Here are 20 water-saving tips to get you going…. 1. Shower Bucket. Instead of letting the water pour down the drain, stick a bucket under the faucet while you wait for your shower water to heat up. You can use the water for flushing the toilet or watering your plants. 2. Turn off the tap while brushing your teeth. Water comes out of the average faucet at 2.5 gallons per minute. Don’t let all that water go down the drain while you brush! Turn off the faucet after you wet your brush, and leave it off until it’s time to rinse. 3. Turn off the tap while washing your hands.

passage 3:Water lawns in the early morning or later evening in 20 minute intervals. Use a broom instead of your hose to remove debris from your driveway or sidewalk. Bathe your pets outdoors in areas that need water. Install a shut-off nozzle on your water hose; a garden hose left running can waste up to 20 litres per minute. Direct downspouts towards shrubs and trees in your garden.

response:
Certainly! Here are some effective tips to conserve water, based on the provided passages:

1. **Take Shorter Showers**: Reduce your shower time to save water.
2. **Use Low-Flow Showerheads**: Install an ultra-low-flow showerhead to minimize water usage. Some units can also cut off the flow without adjusting temperature knobs, which is convenient.
3. **Use a Shower Bucket**: Collect water while waiting for the shower to heat up and use it for flushing the toilet or watering plants.
4. **Turn Off the Tap While Brushing Teeth**: Turn off the faucet while brushing your teeth to avoid wasting water.
5. **Turn Off the Tap While Washing Hands**: Similarly, turn off the tap while washing your hands to save water.
6. **Use the Minimum Water for Baths**: Close the drain first and fill the tub only 1/3 full to use the least amount of water needed.
7. **Water Lawns Efficiently**: Water your lawns in the early morning or later evening to reduce evaporation. Use a broom instead of a hose to remove debris.
8. **Bathe Pets Outdoors**: Bathe your pets outdoors in areas that need water to minimize waste.
9. **Install Shut-Off Nozzles**: Use a shut-off nozzle on your hose to control the flow of water, reducing waste.
10. **Direct Downspouts Strategically**: Direct downspouts towards shrubs and trees in your garden to water them efficiently without overflow.

These tips should help you conserve water effectively. If you need any further assistance or have more questions, feel free to ask!

source_info.question: safely clean your computer screen
source_info.passages:
passage 1:Remember, the less you touch your screen the better. Lightly wipe the screen with a dry and clean microfiber cloth. Microfiber is a miracle of modern technology; put it to good use. passage 2:Instructions. Add 1 part isopropyl alcohol and 1 part distilled water to an empty spray bottle. Close the bottle and shake it to combine the ingredients. Turn off the laptop. It's easier to see the dust and smudges when the screen is dark. Spray a lint-free cloth with the homemade cleaning solution or LCD cleaner.Wipe the laptop screen thoroughly with the cloth to remove any dust or fingerprints. Clean in one direction to prevent streaks.lose the bottle and shake it to combine the ingredients. Turn off the laptop. It's easier to see the dust and smudges when the screen is dark. Spray a lint-free cloth with the homemade cleaning solution or LCD cleaner.

passage 3:1 The microfiber clothes are washable, soft and safe to use on your screens. 2  To clean the edges of your LCD screen use a clean cotton ball or swab. 3  ALWAYS clean your screen powered off! ( 4 I know I said this above, but it is important enough to reiterate.). DO NOT touch your LCD screen, because it will shorten the lifespan of your screen. 2  NEVER use a window or abrasive cleaner on your TV screen as it can cause the screen to yellow and also damage it. 3  If a spot does not come off, do NOT rub harder, because you can kill some of your pixels and ruin your screen.

response:
To safely clean your computer screen, follow these steps based on the provided passages:

1. **Turn Off Your Computer**: Always ensure your computer is powered off before cleaning. This prevents any electrical issues or damage to your screen.

2. **Use a Dry Microfiber Cloth**: Lightly wipe the screen with a dry and clean microfiber cloth. Microfiber is the recommended material as it is safe and effective for screens.

3. **Avoid Abrasive Materials**: Do not use paper towels, kitchen towels, household rags, or any other materials that are not microfiber. These can scratch or damage the screen.

4. **For Dust and Smudges**: If you need to remove dust or smudges, you can use a homemade cleaning solution or an LCD cleaner. Mix 1 part isopropyl alcohol with 1 part distilled water in a spray bottle, shake well, and spray a lint-free cloth with the solution.

5. **Wipe in One Direction**: When cleaning, wipe the screen in one direction to prevent streaks and scratches.

6. **Avoid Touching the Screen**: Never touch your LCD screen directly with your fingers as this can shorten the lifespan of your screen.

7. **Clean the Edges**: Use a clean cotton ball or swab to clean the edges of your LCD screen.

8. **Avoid Harsh Cleaners**: Do not use window cleaners or abrasive cleaners on your screen, as they can cause the screen to yellow and damage it.

9. **Do Not Rub Harder**: If a spot does not come off, do not rub harder, as this can damage the pixels and ruin your screen.

By following these steps, you can effectively and safely clean your computer screen while minimizing the risk of damage.

passage 3:Gelish. response:
To soak off Gel polish, you can follow these steps:

1. Soak a cotton ball with acetone remover and place it on one of your fingernails.
2. Wrap the finger with the cotton ball in foil, ensuring the cotton ball stays in contact with the nail.
3. Once the foil is on, the polish should visibly start to come loose from the edges of the nail. Use an orange stick or cuticle pusher to gently push the polish off, being careful not to use anything too sharp that could damage the top layer of your nail.
4. Repeat this process for each nail until all the gel polish is removed.

This method, based on the provided passages, should efficiently help you remove Gel polish.

source_info.question: pros and cons entering workforce or going to graduate school
source_info.passages:
passage 1:A lot of college grads opt to delay their entry into the workforce however, and instead enroll in graduate school. Grad school isn't the right choice for everybody, but for many it's a good option to consider when deciding whether to further your education or enter the workforce.n the other hand, the graduates who are able to find work end up making a lot more than their undergraduate counterparts; the median annual salary plus bonus for a person fresh out of grad school with an MBA is $105,000. Time. Graduate school takes a lot of time, time that many people might not have.

passage 2:Some ambitious students will choose to work and pursue grad school at the same time. This may sound like a lot to handle, but students who take this approach often reap double the rewards. Rather than taking on a paid position, some students elect to volunteer part-time, working around their study schedule.y jcuadmissions November 20, 2014 American college in Rome American university in Rome study abroad in Italy. Undergraduate students hear a lot of conflicting advice when it comes to plotting their course following graduation.

passage 3:There are pros and cons to each decision. Graduate school is expensive and time consuming, yet it allows you to further your education in a specific field. It is a tough decision that I will have to make next December, and some students will have to make as soon as this summer.urthermore, it will give you an opportunity to expand your education, and it will give you more knowledge about your field of study. When you come out of graduate school you will be more educated than a student who went straight into the career world. I also recommend holding a part time job while in graduate school.

response:
**Pros of Entering the Workforce:**

1. **Earnings:** Graduates entering the workforce right after undergraduate can earn a significant amount of money, often more than their peers who delay entering the workforce to pursue graduate studies. For example, an MBA graduate can make a median annual salary of $105,000, which is a substantial starting point.
2. **Real-World Experience:** Early entry into the workforce provides valuable practical experience, which can be highly beneficial for career development and personal growth.
3. **Financial Independence:** Entering the workforce allows individuals to become financially independent sooner, which can provide a sense of security and freedom.

**Cons of Entering the Workforce:**

1. **Competition:** The job market can be highly competitive, especially for recent graduates. Gaining entry-level positions might be challenging without additional qualifications or experience.
2. **Limited Earning Potential:** Without advanced degrees, individuals may face limited opportunities for higher-paying jobs in specialized fields.
3. **Lack of Specialization:** Without further education, individuals may not have the advanced knowledge and skills necessary to excel in specialized roles.

**Pros of Going to Graduate School:**

1. **Specialized Knowledge:** Graduate school allows individuals to deepen their knowledge and skills in a specific field, making them more competitive in the job market.
2. **Higher Salaries:** As mentioned, graduates with advanced degrees, particularly those with an MBA, can command higher salaries and bonuses.
3. **Career Advancement:** Advanced degrees can open up more career opportunities and higher-level positions, providing a pathway to leadership roles.
4. **Personal Growth:** The academic environment and the challenges of graduate school can foster personal and professional growth.

**Cons of Going to Graduate School:**

1. **Cost and Time:** Graduate school is expensive and time-consuming, which can be a significant financial and personal burden. It often requires a long-term commitment and may delay entry into the workforce.
2. **Debt:** The cost of graduate school can lead to significant student loan debt, which may impact financial stability for years after graduation.
3. **Uncertainty:** The decision to attend graduate school is not always clear-cut and can be influenced by various factors, including personal goals and career aspirations.

**Additional Note:**

source_info.question: how to plough a field
source_info.passages:
passage 1:I have an MF 245, a small 3 point plow, a disk harrow, and a cultivator. I have a 30 acre farm in WV, and want to plow and plant a wildflower meadow. The field in mind used to grow crops many years ago, and other fields on my place mainly grew hay.urn around at the end and plow back up the field with the first bottom completely over lapping so that the middle hill is higher than the rest again as straight as you can.When you get to the top again line up the wheel in the ditch(furrow) so that the first bottom is covering up the furrow.

passage 2:Tractor field plowing. Find the center of the field in the front center and back, mark off the center with stakes or sticks if you want to just run them over.Eye up the last stake with the first two just to give yourself a straight line. Line up the tractor on the stakes and plow as straight as you can.ind the center of the field in the front center and back, mark off the center with stakes or sticks if you want to just run them over. Eye up the last stake with the first two just to give yourself a straight line.

passage 3:The answer to your question depends on the size and shape of your field, and the size of your plow. You have a myriad of answers, and some are thoughtful, some make no sense to other than the sender, per his acreage. google...Operation, Care, and Repair of Farm Machinery, by John Deere.'m new to farming (no family background in it, I'm just learning as I go) so I don't really know how one plows a field with a regular plow (not a reversible/rollover type). I bought a large tractor and a 4 furrow plow, now I just need to get out there.

response:
Plowing a field involves several steps to ensure it is done effectively and straight. Here's a summary based on the provided passages:

1. **Prepare for Plowing**:
   - Use stakes or sticks to mark the center of the field both at the front and back. This helps you maintain a straight line while plowing.
   - Line up the tractor on the stakes to ensure it starts on the correct path. Use the last stake to align with the first two, creating a straight line.

2. **Plowing the First Pass**:
   - Start at the end of the field and plow back up the field, ensuring the first bottom of the plow completely overlaps the previous pass. This helps in creating a uniform depth and coverage.
   - When you reach the top of the field again, line up the wheel in the ditch (furrow) so that the first bottom of the plow covers up the furrow from the previous pass. This ensures a continuous and smooth row of plow marks.

3. **Repeat the Process**:
   - Continue plowing in this manner, maintaining the overlap and alignment to ensure the entire field is plowed uniformly.
   - The specifics of the plowing technique, such as the type of plow and the depth of plowing, should be considered based on the size and shape of your field and the type of plow you are using. For example, using a 3-point plow, a disk harrow, and a cultivator as mentioned in Passage 1, you would adjust your approach to suit these tools.

4. **Considerations**:
   - The size and shape of your field and the type of plow you have will influence the specific steps you take. For instance, a reversible or rollover type plow may require different maneuvers compared to a standard plow.
   - For a 30-acre field in West Virginia, as mentioned in Passage 1, ensure that each pass is as straight and overlapping as possible to maintain even coverage and soil quality.

While the passages provide a general guideline, they do not cover every specific detail for every type of field and plow. For more detailed information, consulting resources like 'Operation, Care, and Repair of Farm Machinery, by John Deere' can be beneficial, especially for new farmers learning as they go.

In summary, the key steps involve marking the center of the field, lining up the tractor, plowing with overlapping passes, and ensuring the wheel aligns with the furrow to create a straight and uniform plowing pattern.

source_info.question: how to make an egg bake in the oven

passage 1:1 Break an egg into each pot. 2  Top off with the rest of the ham and chives and cover with the cheese. 3  Set the pots on a baking plate and in the oven for 15 minutes or until the cheese seems melted and crispy. 4  Set the pot onto little plates and serve with some bread.
